Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery amphora; hoplite to right (helmet with added red and white, shoulder with added white baldric, possibly trace of shield, raised right arm and possibly part of spear).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "5" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other am1371 sherds. 221 written in pencil on interior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0903)
